alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Monroe; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 1:30PM EDT until June 02 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in BLACKSBURG has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Summers County in southeastern West Virginia... North central Mercer County in southeastern West Virginia... Northwestern Monroe County in southeastern West Virginia... * Until 200 PM EDT. * At 130 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Ellison, or near Pipestem, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hinton... Alderson... Union... Pipestem... Pickaway... Buck... and Wayside. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for damaging winds, as well as deadly cloud to ground lightning. For your safety, move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Stay away from windows. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of hail of any size, as well as reports of any wind damage, including downed trees or large limbs, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
